lines.text:
[going into the stage stop]
Well, they tell me they got a good man runnin' this place.

[laconically]
Let you know after I drink his coffee.

You walk out of this house and you go out the way you came in... with nothing but the clothes on your back! I wouldn't depend on goin' to Hayes either... cause Mace is gonna kill him... if he already hasn't.
I love you, Clay. I guess I know I always will... but if you let anything happen to John Hayes, I swear I'll see you hang!

[Admiring Norma]
That's a lot of woman!
Ever here any of us disagreeing... about that?

[Realizing that their horses have been run off]
You know, it's ten miles back to town!

[after a pause, he punches him, knocks him to the ground, and replies dryly]
Closer to eleven.
Why didn't you write to me?

[after a pause]
Would it have made any difference?
Trouble with you, Clay, is that you're rich enough to be an honorable man. I can't afford it.

[Shocked that his men have killed a little girl]
And to think this happened in the name of the Confederacy!
Whether the South wins or loses means nothing to me - never has!
